intro: Rafnia affinis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hard, spiny capsule. Rafnia affinis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
